stem: The nurse is preparing to perform a sterile dressing change on a post-surgical wound. Place the steps in the correct order.

options.text: Cleanse the wound using sterile saline and apply the new dressing.
Inspect the wound and discard the old dressing and clean gloves.
Open the sterile dressing kit and establish a sterile field.
Wash hands and don clean gloves to remove the old dressing.

pedagogy.nclexCategory: Safety and Infection Prevention and Control

rationale.correct: The transition from 'clean' to 'sterile' is critical. (1) Remove the dirty items with clean gloves. (2) Assess the baseline. (3) Prepare the field *before* putting on sterile gloves so you can touch the outer edges of the kit. (4) Sterilize the hands. (5) Perform the procedure.
rationale.incorrect: Putting on sterile gloves *before* opening the sterile kit is incorrect because the outside of the kit is not sterile.
clinicalPearls: Remember the 1-inch border of a sterile field is considered contaminated.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember you must open the 'paper' (kit flaps) with your bare hands (or clean gloves) *before* putting on the sterile gloves. You can't open a box with sterile gloves without contaminating them.

reviewUnits.heading: Principles of Sterile Technique
reviewUnits.body: Nurses must maintain objects within the field range and avoid reaching over the field. Any break in technique requires starting over with new supplies.
